parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To bring a charge against, accuse. From en and kaleo; to call in, i.e. Bring to account.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
A question, subject of inquiry, dispute. From zeteo; a search, i.e. a debate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
An accusation, charge. From egkaleo; an accusation, i.e. Offence alleged.
Worthy, worthy of, deserving, comparable, suitable. Probably from ago; deserving, comparable or suitable.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Or desmos des-mos' neuter and masculine respectively from deo; a band, i.e. Ligament or shackle; figuratively, an impediment or disability.
